publicwhip.spmotion: S1M-9 Euan Robson: That the Parliament calls on Her Majesty’s Government to amend the Scottish Adjacent Waters Boundaries Order (Statutory Instrument 1999/1126) made under the Scotland Act 1998 so that the East Coast boundary is redrawn to a line of latitude due east of the termination point of the land border between England and Scotland to re-establish the custom and practice of former years (lodged 19 May 1999). Supported by: Tavish Scott, Mike Rumbles, George Lyon, Jamie Stone

S1M-9 Euan Robson: That the Parliament calls on Her Majesty’s Government to amend the Scottish Adjacent Waters Boundaries Order (S.I.1999/1126) made under the Scotland Act 1998 so that the east coast boundary is redrawn to a line of latitude due east of the termination point of land border between England and Scotland to re-establish the custom and practice of former years (lodged on 19 May 1999). Supported by: Tavish Scott, Mike Rumbles, George Lyon, Jamie Stone

* S1M-9 Euan Robson: That this Parliament calls on Her Majesty’s Government to amend the Scottish Adjacent Waters Boundaries Order (Statutory Instrument No.1126) made under the Scotland Act 1998 so that the East Coast boundary is redrawn to a line of latitude due east of the termination point of land border between England and Scotland to re-establish the custom and practice of former years (lodged 19th May 1999). Supported by: Tavish Scott, Mike Rumbles, George Lyon, Jamie Stone

S1M-9 Euan Robson: That the Parliament calls on Her Majesty’s Government to amend the Scottish Adjacent Waters Boundaries Order (Statutory Instrument 1999/1126) made under the Scotland Act 1998 so that the East Coast boundary is redrawn to a line of latitude due east of the termination point of the land border between England and Scotland to re-establish the custom and practice of former years (lodged 19 May 1999). Supported by: Tavish Scott, Mike Rumbles, George Lyon, Jamie Stone
